block.p: Using the Nations' Cup format adapted from show jumping, the United States equestrian team's reining horse squad won the first internationally sanctioned reining horse competition at the team's Festival of Champions yesterday in Gladstone, N.J.

Scott McCutcheon of Whitesboro, Tex., led the home team, scoring 449 points of Team USA's 1,330.5 points with scores of 224 in the morning round and 225 in the afternoon riding his bay quarter horse Martha's Mega Jack.

Using the Nations' Cup format adapted from show jumping, the United States equestrian team's reining horse squad won the first internationally sanctioned reining horse competition at the team's Festival of Champions yesterday in Gladstone, N.J.

Scott McCutcheon of Whitesboro, Tex., led the home team, scoring 449 points of Team USA's 1,330.5 points with scores of 224 in the morning round and 225 in the afternoon riding his bay quarter horse Martha's Mega Jack.
Bill Horn of Weatherford, Tex., collected 220.5 points in the morning and 219 in the afternoon riding Trashadeous, a chestnut horse owned by Mitchell and Sylvia Zuckerman of North Salem, N.Y.
Francois Gauthier, a resident of Lucama, N.C., who rides for Team Canada, led the international competitors with 216 and 221.5 riding the palomino stallion Don Quintana.
